ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Please rate your fatigue (weariness, tiredness) by clicking on the button that best describes your WORST level of fatigue during the past 24 hours.
Notes: 0=No Fatigue; 10=As bad as you can imagine

ElementDescription: Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Filling up quickly when you eat (early satiety)
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Abdominal discomfort
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Inactivity

Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Problems with concentration - compared to prior to my myeloproliferative disorder (MPD)
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Night sweats
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Itching (pruritus)
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Bone pain (diffuse not joint pain or arthritis)
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Fever (greater than 100 degrees F)
Circle the one number that describes, during the past week, how much difficulty you have had with each of the following symptoms: Unintentional weight loss last 6 months
Patient symptom score (sum of all 10 items)
Check the one box that describes the worst level of interference you had with performing daily and/or planned activities during the past week
Notes: 1=No interference with activities; 5=Unable to perform activities at all

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
